pullRequest.body:
The stronger statement is necessary when we wish that `H` and `H ⊔ N` in the statement `_ ⧸ N.subgroupOf H ≃* _ ⧸ N.subgroupOf (H ⊔ N)` may need to be of a type larger than whichever subgroup `H` is normal in. Furthermore, this commit adapts some basic results about Normal subgroups to be wrt subgroups of normalizers instead.

Moves:
- Subgroup.le_normalizer_of_normal -> Subgroup.le_normalizer_of_normal_subgroupOf

---

The primary reason for introducing this variation is that the existing formulation becomes a pain when quotienting subnormal groups. So suppose my ambient group is `G` and my normalizer is `T : Subgroup G`, the result I can get from the existing formulation is something like `_ ⧸ (N : T).subgroupOf (H : T) ≃* _ ⧸ (N : T).subgroupOf (H ⊔ N : T)`, and it is difficult or tedious to recover the desired statement `_ ⧸ N.subgroupOf H ≃* _ ⧸ N.subgroupOf (H ⊔ N)` from it.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

No problem, it's not urgent

On Fri, 14 Mar 2025, 10:41 Thomas Browning, ***@***.***>
wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Subgroup/Basic.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22650#discussion_r1994592197>
> :
>
> > @@ -351,12 +351,29 @@ theorem normalizer_eq_top [h : H.Normal] : H.normalizer = ⊤ :=
>    normalizer_eq_top_iff.mpr h
>
>  @[to_additive]
> -theorem le_normalizer_of_normal [hK : (H.subgroupOf K).Normal] (HK : H ≤ K) : K ≤ H.normalizer :=
> +theorem subset_normalizer_of_normal {S : Set G} [hH : H.Normal] : S ⊆ H.normalizer :=
> +  normalizer_eq_top H ▸ le_top
> +
> +/- TODO: rename `le_normalizer_of_normal'` -> `le_normalizer_of_normal` when the current deprecation
> +`le_normalizer_of_normal` -> `le_normalizer_of_normal_subgroupOf` is completed.
> +-/
> ***@***.***_additive]
> +theorem le_normalizer_of_normal' [hH : H.Normal] : K ≤ H.normalizer := subset_normalizer_of_normal
> +
> ***@***.***_additive]
> +theorem le_normalizer_of_normal_subgroupOf [hK : (H.subgroupOf K).Normal] (HK : H ≤ K) :
>
> Is it possible for this PR to wait for #22913
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22913>? I feel
> that there's some cleanup of these normalizer lemmas that should happen
> first.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22650#pullrequestreview-2683872519>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AARGNIJJGANMSJU2B5DELPD2UI6XJAVCNFSM6AAAAABYPHTXWOVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43YUDVNRWFEZLROVSXG5CSMV3GSZLXHMZDMOBTHA3TENJRHE>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>
The variable `S` isn't defined earlier in the file so I think we should specify the type here to help with readability (not sure if there are style conventions for this!)

Since you're adding results about both `normalizer` and `setNormalizer`, what do you think of adding a `SetNormalizer` just below the `Nomalizer` section you're currently working in the segment the results?

```
-- variant for sets.
-- TODO should this replace `normalizer`?
```

Come to think of it I'm going to follow this TODO and replace `normalizer` with `setNormalizer` and see what effect this has, before providing separate results for `setNormalizer`. If things look good I'll open a separate PR for the normalizer stuff that should be merged prior to this.

I'm deciding against this because the current `normalizer` is extensively used, and more natural. Furthermore, the normalizer of a set is the normalizer of the subgroup it generates, and results about `setNormalizer` can always be rephrased in that way. Hence I'll be removing the `setNormalizer` results.
(small nitpick): it's a little confusing to have `mem_normalizer_iff` and `mem_normalizer_iff''`  above `mem_normalizer_iff'` - would you mind reordering them?

Note that you could get rid of the optional parameters by doing something along the lines of 
```suggestion
noncomputable def quotientInfEquivProdNormalizerQuotient (H N : Subgroup G)
    (hLE : H ≤ N.normalizer)
    letI := Subgroup.inf_subgroupOf_normal_of_le_normalizer hLE
    letI := Subgroup.subgroupOf_sup_normal_of_le_normalizer hLE
    H ⧸ N.subgroupOf H ≃* (H ⊔ N : Subgroup G) ⧸ N.subgroupOf (H ⊔ N) :=
  letI := Subgroup.inf_subgroupOf_normal_of_le_normalizer hLE
  letI := Subgroup.subgroupOf_sup_normal_of_le_normalizer hLE
```
Ah thanks, I see now this is a common idiom in mathlib

I think adding `H ⊔ N` might help with readability (though the original statement did also omit the `H ⊔ N`)
```suggestion
    H ⧸ N.subgroupOf H ≃*  (H ⊔ N : Subgroup G) ⧸ N.subgroupOf (H ⊔ N) :=
```

The edit I suggested had a typo in it:)
```suggestion
    (hLE : H ≤ N.normalizer) :
```
Ah apologies too; I didn't come back to review the result of the CI job
Is it possible for this PR to wait for #22913? I feel that there's some cleanup of these normalizer lemmas that should happen first.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Group/Subgroup, GroupTheory/QuotientGroup): strengthen second isomorphism theorem for groups
